statement: Provider batch APIs are async and polling-based; a polling-first adapter with staged batches, centralized rate limiting, and Convex-ID-based idempotency (using existing IDs and null-state checks) is the pragmatic baseline.
rationale: Provider docs describe polling and output files/jobs; user prefers Convex IDs over ad hoc hashes for idempotency.
keyAssumptions: Convex IDs plus stage/model/provider are sufficient to identify unique requests.
validationCriteria: Blueprint specifies composite uniqueness on existing IDs and uses null values to determine retries.
critiquePoints: If prompts change across retries, a version field may be required to avoid false idempotency.
questions: Do we add a request_version or attempt counter for forced reruns?
What polling backoff schedule should we use per provider?
